alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 6:33PM EST until February 18 at 5:31PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Rouge River At Detroit affecting Wayne County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rouge River At Detroit. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, The river reaches bankfull. At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins in some park areas, the River Rouge Municipal Golf Course, and a few homes. Most flood damage occurs on the Upper Rouge River with minor flooding occurring on the main branch. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 PM EST Thursday was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 16.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning to 9.5 feet and begin rising again Monday evening. It will rise to 9.9 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.6 feet on 01/12/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
